Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Vase
Description: Small ovoid jar with carinated body. The orifice is wide, neckless, with a flared convex lip. The junction of the body and the lip is enhanced by a small convex roll. It was carefully manufactured: the vessel was polished and covered with a dark red slip and then burnished; this is reminiscent of Kerma productions.
